intro: Tonemone malukuana, commonly known as the Maluku tonemone, is a rare flowering plant native to the Maluku Islands in Indonesia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a slightly waxy texture. Tonemone malukuana is adapted to grow in humid, shaded environments, often found in forest understories.
